title: Thorntons to build new store on Bardstown Road
text:
Thorntons has razed an old hotel in the 3200 block of Bardstown Road at Goldsmith Lane and plans to build a new store on the site to replace an existing Thorntons outlet on another corner at the intersection.
Thorntons bought a 4.6-acre parcel at 3255 Bardstown Road in August for $2.6 million and recently demolished the old Midtown Inn & Suites on the site. The hotel for many years was the Holiday Inn Southeast.
Thorntons now has two existing stores at the intersection: one on the northeast corner and a newly remodeled one on the southeast corner.
Thorntons spokeswoman Erin Jones said the store on the southeast corner will remain. A Rally's restaurant and a Steak & Shake are located at the fourth corner of the intersection.
Louisville-based Thorntons has recently been in an expansive mode. In late summer, it announced that it is moving to a new headquarters in the city as part of an expansion that will add 110 jobs.
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Thorntons plans $28M HQ expansion
The announcement was made after the company was approved by a state board for up to $2.6 million in incentives for the $27.78 million headquarters project.
The convenience chain retailer will be relocating the headquarters from its current 46,000-square-foot facility on Linn Station Road to a new 92,500-square-foot store support center on Old Henry Road with construction expected to begin later this year.
The company also has recently rebuilt several stores including one downtown on Broadway.
Family-owned Thorntons was established in 1971 and now owns more than 180 stores in six states.
